poem:
**The Crossing**

Abandoned yacht, a life raft afloat,
two souls entwined in salt and sorrow.
Six weeks of whispers, waves their shroud,
found on Sable's distant isle,
a testament to love and loss,
where sea meets sky,
and stories sleep beneath the foam.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "British woman and husband found dead after failed Atlantic crossing The bodies of a couple who were on a sailing trip across the Atlantic Ocean have been found on a life raft that washed up on a remote Canadian island almost six weeks after they were last seen. Briton Sarah Packwood, 54, and her Canadian husband Brett Clibbery, 70, are thought to have abandoned their yacht and died before washing up on Sable Island –". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
